What is the equation for calculating speed?
Distance over time
What is the unit of force?
Newton (N)
What does Newton's First Law of Motion state?
An object will remain at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by an external force (ie. inertia)
What type of wave is sound?
Longitudinal wave
What is the law of conservation of energy?
Energy can not be created or destroyed, only transformed,
What does a convex lens do to light rays?
Converges (focuses) them
What is the difference between mass and weight?
Mass is the amount of matter (kg), weight is the force due to gravity (N)
What is the principle behind a hydraulic system?
Pascal's Principle (Pressure force is transmitted equally in all directions)
What is the smallest unit of an element?
Atom
What is the pH of a neutral solution, below which becomes acidic, above alkaline?
pH 7
What is the process of a liquid turning into a gas called?
Evaporation
What is the difference between an element and a compound?
An element is made of one type of atom, compound 2+ bonded elements
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
Au
What is the process of a solid turning directly into a gas called?
Sublimation
What is the main gas responsible for climate change?
Carbon dioxide, CO2
What causes the seasons on Earth?
Earth's axial tilt
What causes tides?
Gravitational pull of the moon
What is the closest star to Earth?
The sun
What causes earthquakes?
Movement of tectonic plates
What is the name of the galaxy we live in?
the Milky Way
Name 6 planets from the Sun
Mercury / Venus / Earth / Mars / Jupiter / Saturn / Uranus / Neptune
Why does ice float on water?
ice is less dense than water with more air inside
Why do metals conduct electricity?
They have free-moving electrons
What is the difference between a physical and chemical changes?
Physical alters form, while chemical creates new substance
What is the name of the process where a gas turns into a liquid?
Condensation
What do we call a substance that speeds up a reaction without being consumed?
Catalyst
What is the term for the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent?
Concentration
What is the unit of power?
Watt (W)
What is Newton's Third Law of Motion?
For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction
What is the formula for calculating acceleration?
change in velocity / change in time, (velocity is speed with a direction)
